anthony_davies,"2019-09-06T23:44:34.62Z","A charming and useful little set.","

40188 Pencil Pot is a small set that could easily be overlooked by Lego fans or people buying gifts for others.
column2: Very few people have it or want it on Brickset, and no one has written a review of it.&nbsp
column3: Having just built the set, I really like it.&nbsp
column4: Lego is typically used to build things to play with or display, but using Lego to build useful items is perhaps underappreciated. &nbsp

column1: The build is simple but has some nice details, including some simple SNOT techniques and nice little mini-builds like the lawn mower.
column3: This bearded dude with a flannel shirt and messy hair looks the part.&nbsp
column4: There is a great range of parts included in this set, including a door and window which are not shown in most pictures of the set.&nbsp
column5: The great thing about these parts it that once you have built the set as a pencil holder, you could use the parts as the basis for building your own Lego houses by adding other pieces in your collection.

column1: The completed model looks wonderful in a way reminiscent of traditional Lego house sets.
column2: The house is the right size to function as a pencil/pen holder.&nbsp
column3: The garage door opens to allow small items to be recovered from the bottom of the pot.&nbsp
column4: The house can also be easily lifted off the base to tip things out of it.&nbsp
column5: This square house can also be placed on the base facing in different directions, which is good because the other sides not shown in the photo are interesting in their own right.&nbsp
column6: The garden bed is another nice little build.&nbsp
column7: It is too small to house post-it notes, but could be used for paperclips or a pencil sharpener etc.&nbsp
column8: My only complaint would be the vent structure above the garage door.&nbsp
column9: This serves the function of restricting the movement of the door, but it looks odd and does not seem to replicate any feature seen on normal houses.

column1: The house has two bricks with two holes for technic pins sitting on the base.
column2: This allows you to connect the house (but not the green base) to the 40173 picture frame or any of the recent creator buildings.

column1: This set is very reasonably priced, it is a nice little build, and the completed model looks charming and works as a functional pencil/pen holder.
column2: In addition you have a great range of pieces to use as part of making your own traditional style Lego houses if you wish.&nbsp
column3: Long after a child has packed away their other Lego sets, this might be sitting on their desk holding their pencils.&nbsp
column4: This set is everything that is good about Lego, and I highly recommend it.
